dmu_description: This DMU provides the final spectra and redshift catalogues, including GAMA AAT and external data.
description:
This table contains the complete output of the redshifting code for
all spectra released in DR2.  Note that many spectra were redshifted
more than once and this catalogue contains all duplications.

columns.description: Catalogue source(s) of matched GAMA object
columns.name: IC_FLAG

columns.description: Distance between spectrum and matched GAMA object
columns.name: DIST

columns.description: Extinction corrected SDSS r-band Petrosian magnitude
columns.name: RMAG

columns.description: Number of matching emission lines at best emission line redshift
columns.name: NEB

columns.description: Total number of detected potential emission lines
columns.name: NEG

columns.description: Automatic quality of final selected redshift
columns.name: QA

columns.description: User assigned quality of final selected redshift
columns.name: QOP

columns.description: Flag indicating whether Z_FIN is different from automatic redshifts: 0 = equal to best auto redshift; 1 = not equal to best auto redshift; 2 = not equal to either auto redshifts
columns.name: F

columns.description: Approximate V-band fibre mag with zeropoint 32
columns.name: VSP

columns.description: Approximate R-band fibre mag with zeropoint 32.3
columns.name: RSP

dmu_description: This DMU provides the final spectra and redshift catalogues, including GAMA AAT and external data.
description:
Many GAMA AAT spectra were redshifted more than once. For each
spectrum included in DR2 this table contains one line summarising
all of the redshifting results for this spectrum, as well as listing
the results of the analysis to determine the best redshift based on
the reliabilities of the redshifters.
name: AATSpecAllzAll

columns.description: Catalogue source(s) of matched GAMA object
columns.name: IC_FLAG

columns.description: Distance between spectrum and matched GAMA object
columns.name: DIST

columns.description: Number of opinions for this spectrum
columns.name: N_OP

columns.description: Probability that the most probable possibility is correct
columns.name: BEST_PROB

columns.description: Redshift of the most probable possibility
columns.name: BEST_Z

columns.description: Normalised Q of the most probable possibility
columns.name: BEST_Z_NQ

columns.description: Number of opinions supporting the most probable possibility
columns.name: BEST_Z_N

columns.description: Probability that all offered possibilities are wrong
columns.name: COMP_PROB

columns.description: Probability that the possibility Q=1 is correct
columns.name: Q1_PROB

columns.description: Index of best possibility in the above list
columns.name: BEST_IDX

columns.description: ID of original runz result in AATRunzResults
columns.name: OP1_RUNZRESID

columns.description: Index of possibility in above list that is supported by this redshift
columns.name: OP1_ZIDX

columns.description: ID of additional runz result in AATRunzResults
columns.name: OP2_RUNZRESID

columns.description: Index of possibility in above list that is supported by this redshift
columns.name: OP2_ZIDX

columns.description: ID of additional runz result in AATRunzResults
columns.name: OP3_RUNZRESID

columns.description: Index of possibility in above list that is supported by this redshift
columns.name: OP3_ZIDX

columns.description: ID of additional runz result in AATRunzResults
columns.name: OP4_RUNZRESID

columns.description: Index of possibility in above list that is supported by this redshift
columns.name: OP4_ZIDX

columns.description: ID of additional runz result in AATRunzResults
columns.name: OP5_RUNZRESID

columns.description: Index of possibility in above list that is supported by this redshift
columns.name: OP5_ZIDX

This is a table of all GAMA AAT spectra included in DR2. Many

are retained here.

columns.name: NQ

columns.name: IC_FLAG

columns.description: Distance between spectrum and matched GAMA object
columns.name: DIST

columns.description: Is this the best GAMA AAT spectrum of this object?
columns.name: IS_SBEST

dmu_description: This DMU provides the final spectra and redshift catalogues, including GAMA AAT and external data.

This table lists a small number of spectra of fibre-bright targets
collected by the GAMA team at the Liverpool Telescope (LT).

columns.description: Distance between spectrum and matched GAMA object

columns.description: Is this the best GAMA LT spectrum of this object?

dmu_description: This DMU provides the final spectra and redshift catalogues, including GAMA AAT and external data.
description:
This table lists all spectra that are available for GAMA objects
included in DR2, including GAMA spectra and those from previous
spectroscopic surveys (such as the SDSS). Duplicate observations of
the same object are retained in this table (but a flag is provided
to mark the spectrum that provided the best available redshift of a
given object). Every spectrum listed in this table is available in
the GAMA DR2 database.
name: SpecAll

columns.description: Normalised redshift quality (use nQ > 2 for science)
columns.name: NQ

columns.description: Full path and filename of the spectrum
columns.name: FILENAME

columns.description: Catalogue source(s) of matched GAMA object
columns.name: IC_FLAG

columns.description: Distance between spectrum and matched GAMA object
columns.name: DIST

columns.description: Is this the best spectrum of this GAMA object within the originating survey?
columns.name: IS_SBEST

columns.description: Is this the best spectrum of this GAMA object?
columns.name: IS_BEST

dmu_description: This DMU provides the final spectra and redshift catalogues, including GAMA AAT and external data.
description:
This table lists each observed target included in DR2 and the
spectrum that provides its best redshift (from GAMA or otherwise).

columns.description: Number of spectra available for this object
columns.name: N_SPEC

columns.description: Number of GAMA spectra available for this object
columns.name: N_GAMA_SPEC

columns.description: Distance between GAMA object and best matched spectrum
columns.name: DIST

columns.description: Normalised redshift quality (use nQ > 2 for science)
columns.name: NQ

columns.description: Full path and filename of the spectrum
columns.name: FILENAME

dmu_description: This DMU collects spectra for GAMA DR2 objects from previous spectroscopic surveys such as the SDSS.
description:
This table lists all spectra of GAMA DR2 objects that are available
from previous spectroscopic surveys (such as the SDSS), including
duplicate observations. Every spectrum listed in this table is
available in the GAMA DR2 database.
name: ExternalSpecAll

columns.description: Full path and filename of the spectrum
columns.name: FILENAME

columns.description: Normalised redshift quality (use nQ > 2 for science)
columns.name: NQ

columns.description: Catalogue source(s) of matched GAMA object
columns.name: IC_FLAG

columns.description: Distance between spectrum and matched GAMA object
columns.name: DIST

columns.description: Is this the spectrum with the best redshift of this GAMA object within the originating survey?
columns.name: IS_SBEST

dmu_description: This DMU collects spectra for GAMA DR2 objects from previous spectroscopic surveys such as the SDSS.
description:
This table lists those spectra from previous spectroscopic surveys
(such as the SDSS) that provide the best redshifts for GAMA DR2
objects. This table is an exact subset of the table
ExternalSpecAll. It lists only those entries with IS_SBEST = TRUE,
meaning that it excludes intra-survey duplicate observations.
However, it still includes inter-survey duplications.
name: ExternalSpec

columns.description: Normalised redshift quality (use nQ > 2 for science)
columns.name: NQ

columns.description: Full path and filename of the spectrum
columns.name: FILENAME

columns.description: Catalogue source(s) of matched GAMA object
columns.name: IC_FLAG

columns.description: Distance between spectrum and matched GAMA object
columns.name: DIST

columns.description: Is this the spectrum with the best redshift of this GAMA object within the originating survey?
columns.name: IS_SBEST

dmu_description: This DMU collects spectra for GAMA DR2 objects from previous spectroscopic surveys such as the SDSS.

dmu_description: This DMU provides stellar masses, restframe photometry, and other ancillary stellar population parameters for all z < 0.65 galaxies in the GAMA DR2 sample.
description:
This table provides stellar masses, restframe photometry, and other
ancillary stellar population parameters from stellar population fits
to ugriz SEDs for all z < 0.65 galaxies in the GAMA DR2 sample.
name: StellarMasses

columns.description: Normalised redshift quality (use nQ > 2 for science)
columns.name: nQ

columns.description: Flow corrected redshift using Tonry et al. model
columns.name: Z_TONRY

columns.description: Aperture correction factor for scaling total luminosities and stellar masses (see notes)
columns.name: fluxscale

columns.description: Maximum redshift for which r_petro <= 19.4 (G09/G15 SURVEY_CLASS>=6 selection)
columns.name: zmax_19p4

columns.description: Maximum redshift for which r_petro <= 19.8 (G12 SURVEY_CLASS>=6 selection)
columns.name: zmax_19p8

columns.description: Maximum redshift for which r_petro <= 17.8 (SDSS main survey selection)
columns.name: zmax_17p88

columns.description: Number of bands used in SPS fits (max. is 5; NIR data have not been used)
columns.name: nbands

columns.description: Stellar mass within the photometric aperture represented as log10(M_*/[M_Sol]) (see notes)
columns.name: logmstar

columns.description: Mass-to-light ratio (restframe i-band) represented as log10( (M_*/L_i) / [M_Sol/L_Sol,i] )
columns.name: logmoverl_i

columns.description: SPS age T = t(z_obs) - t(z_form), represented as log10(T/[yr])
columns.name: logage

columns.description: SPS e-folding time for the exponentially declining SFH, represented as log10(tau/[yr])
columns.name: logtau

columns.description: SPS dust obscuration; for Calzetti et al. (2003) dust A_V = 3.1 x E(B-V)
columns.name: extBV

columns.description: Restframe i-band luminosity weighted mean stellar age, represented as log10(t*/[yr])
columns.name: logLWage

columns.description: Intrinsic, stellar (g-i) colour from SED fit, i.e. corrected for internal dust obscuration
columns.name: gminusi_stars

columns.description: Intrinsic, stellar (u-r) colour from SED fit, i.e. corrected for internal dust obscuration
columns.name: uminusr_stars

columns.description: Correlation coefficient between logmstar and uminusi for covariant error matrix
columns.name: C_logM_ur

columns.description: Correlation coefficient between logmstar and gminusi for covariant error matrix
columns.name: C_logM_gi

columns.description: Correlation coefficient between logmstar and extBV for covariant error matrix
columns.name: C_logM_eBV

columns.description: Best-fit observers` frame u-band apparent magnitude from SPS SED fits
columns.name: fitphot_u

columns.description: Absolute magnitude in restframe u-band from SPS SED fits
columns.name: absmag_u

columns.description: Intrinsic abs. mag. of all stellar emission (i.e. corrected for internal dust extinction) in restframe u-band
columns.name: absmag_u_stars

columns.description: Best-fit observers` frame g-band apparent magnitude from SPS SED fits
columns.name: fitphot_g

columns.description: Absolute magnitude in restframe g-band from SPS SED fits
columns.name: absmag_g

columns.description: Intrinsic abs. mag. of all stellar emission (i.e. corrected for internal dust extinction) in restframe g-band
columns.name: absmag_g_stars

columns.description: Best-fit observers` frame r-band apparent magnitude from SPS SED fits
columns.name: fitphot_r

columns.description: Absolute magnitude in restframe r-band from SPS SED fits
columns.name: absmag_r

columns.description: Intrinsic abs. mag. of all stellar emission (i.e. corrected for internal dust extinction) in restframe r-band
columns.name: absmag_r_stars

columns.description: Best-fit observers` frame i-band apparent magnitude from SPS SED fits
columns.name: fitphot_i

columns.description: Absolute magnitude in restframe i-band from SPS SED fits
columns.name: absmag_i

columns.description: Intrinsic abs. mag. of all stellar emission (i.e. corrected for internal dust extinction) in restframe i-band
columns.name: absmag_i_stars

columns.description: Best-fit observers` frame z-band apparent magnitude from SPS SED fits
columns.name: fitphot_z

columns.description: Absolute magnitude in restframe z-band from SPS SED fits
columns.name: absmag_z

columns.description: Intrinsic abs. mag. of all stellar emission (i.e. corrected for internal dust extinction) in restframe z-band
columns.name: absmag_z_stars

dmu_description: This DMU provides several different metrics of the local environment of GAMA DR2 galaxies: a surface density, the number of galaxies within a cylinder, and the density of galaxies within an adaptive Gaussian ellipsoid.
description:
This catalogue provides three different environment measures for all
GAMA DR2 galaxies in G15 with 0.002 < z < 0.18: a surface density,
the number of galaxies within a cylinder, and the density of
galaxies within an adaptive Gaussian ellipsoid.
name: EnvironmentMeasures

columns.description: Heliocentric redshift corrected for the effects of peculiar velocity
columns.name: Z_TONRY

columns.description: Extinction and k-corrected absolute r-band magnitude
columns.name: M_r

columns.description: Distance to nearest angular survey edge in co-moving units
columns.name: DistanceToEdge

columns.description: Value used to correct environment measures for local survey incompleteness (see notes)
columns.name: Completeness

columns.description: Distance to 5th nearest neighbour in co-moving units
columns.name: DistanceTo5nn

columns.description: Surface density based on the distance to the 5th nearest neighbour
columns.name: SurfaceDensity

columns.description: Flag indicating problems with surface density measurement (see notes)
columns.name: SurfaceDensityFlag

columns.description: Number of (other) galaxies within cylinder of radius 1 co-moving Mpc
columns.name: CountInCyl

columns.description: Poisson error on number of galaxies in cylinder
columns.name: CountInCylErr

columns.description: Flag indicating problems with CountInCyl (see notes)
columns.name: CountInCylFlag

columns.description: Density of galaxies within an adaptive Gaussian ellipsoid
columns.name: AGEDensity

columns.description: Poisson error on the number of galaxies used to calculate AGEDensity
columns.name: AGEErr

columns.description: Adaptive scaling factor for adaptive Gaussian ellipsoid
columns.name: AGEScale

columns.description: Flag indicating problems with AGEDensity, see notes
columns.name: AGEDensityFlag

dmu_description: This DMU provides the GAMA Galaxy Group Catalogue (G3C).
description: Catalogue of all GAMA galaxies used in the G3C. G15 only.
name: G3CGal

columns.description: Petrosian apparent r-band magnitude (AB, extinction corrected) [GAMA selection magnitude]
columns.name: Rpetro

columns.description: Distance modulus using H0=100 km/s/Mpc, Omega_m=0.25 and Omega_L=0.75
columns.name: DM_100_25_75

columns.description: Source of the redshift. See the notes of table TilingCat in the InputCat DMU for full details
columns.name: SURVEY_CODE

columns.description: Velocity uncertainty (on redshift): assumed to be 30 km/s for SDSS, 50 km/s for GAMA and 80 km/s for 2dFGRS
columns.name: SigErr

columns.description: GroupID of the group this galaxy belongs to as listed in G3CFoFGroup, 0 is un-grouped
columns.name: GroupID

dmu_description: This DMU provides the GAMA Galaxy Group Catalogue (G3C).
description: This is a catalogue of G3C GAMA group properties. G15 only.
name: G3CFoFGroup

columns.description: Unique group ID, as used in G3CGal
columns.name: GroupID

columns.description: GAMA ID of the iterative central galaxy (prefered position of the group centre, see Robotham et al. 2011 section 4.2)
columns.name: IterCenCATAID

columns.description: RA of the iterative central galaxy (J2000)
columns.name: IterCenRA

columns.description: Dec of the iterative central galaxy (J2000)
columns.name: IterCenDEC

columns.description: Redshift of the iterative central galaxy
columns.name: IterCenZ

columns.description: Group radius defined by the 50th percentile group member, based on the projected distance away from IterCenID
columns.name: Rad50

columns.description: Group radius defined by the 68th percentile group member, based on the projected distance away from IterCenID
columns.name: Rad1Sig

columns.description: Group radius defined by the most distant group member, based on the projected distance away from IterCenID
columns.name: Rad100

columns.description: Relative galaxy space density (w.r.t. the SWML prediction) within a cylinder of radius 1.5 Mpc/h and length 18Mpc/h centred on IterCenID.
columns.name: RelDen

columns.description: Average redshift completeness of the group: for each group member the redshift completeness within a projected 1.5 Mpc/h radius (at the position of the galaxy) is estimated and then averaged over all group members to provide ZComp
columns.name: Zcomp

columns.description: Fraction of the group within the survey volume, as estimated from IterCen and Rad100
columns.name: GroupEdge

columns.description: Group velocity dispersion, corrected for the total group velocity dispersion error (VelErr); set to zero if VelErr>VelDispRaw (see eq. 17 in Robotham et al. 2011)
columns.name: VelDisp

columns.description: r-band absolute magnitude of the group, obtained by adding up the r-band luminosities of its members
columns.name: TotRmag

columns.description: Proxy for group total r-band luminosity down to M_r - 5 log_10 h = -14 in solar luminosities. It is based on the total observed r-band flux and the fraction of light (as estimated from the global galaxy LF) observable at the group redshift. Value listed corresponds to B=1 in Eq. 21 of Robotham et al. (2011)
columns.name: TotFluxProxy

columns.description: Proxy for dynamical group mass estimated via M propto Rad50 * VelDisp^2 . Value listed corresponds to A=1 in Eq. 18 of Robotham et al. (2011), i.e. calibrated mass is given by A*M, with A the scaling factor described in section 4.3 of Robotham et al. (2011)
columns.name: MassProxy

columns.description: Apparent r-band magnitude gap between BCG and second brightest group member
columns.name: Rgap

columns.description: RA of group for a r-band luminosity weighted CoM of the system (J2000)
columns.name: CenRA

columns.description: Dec of group for a r-band luminosity weighted CoM of the system (J2000)
columns.name: CenDec

columns.description: Unbiased kurtosis of the radial distribution of galaxies based on the projected distance to IterCen
columns.name: RadKurt

columns.description: Angle of the group major axis on the sky (N -> E = 0 -> 90) using the Carter & Metcalfe (1984) algorithm (requires 3 or more members, so -999 otherwise)
columns.name: AxAng

columns.description: Axial ratio of the group using the Carter & Metcalfe (1984) algorithm (requires 3 or more members, so -999 otherwise)
columns.name: AxRat

columns.description: KS test of the uniformity of groups once corrected for the axial-ratio; an elliptical group has an average p-value of 0.5 (requires 3 or more members, so -999 otherwise)
columns.name: SymKS

columns.description: Unbiased skew of the galaxy velocities (requires 3 or more members, so -999 otherwise)
columns.name: VelSkew

columns.description: Unbiased kurtosis of the galaxy velocities (requires 4 or more members, so -999 otherwise)
columns.name: VelKurt

columns.description: The modality of the system: (1+VelSkew^2)/(3+VelKurt^2). This will be 1/3 for a normal distribution and 0.555 for a uniform.
columns.name: Modality

columns.description: Total number of FoF links in the system
columns.name: LinkTot

columns.description: Link strength in projection, average projected FoF link relative to the separation allowed by the FoF algorithm (0<=LinkStrenProj<=1)
columns.name: LinkStrenProj

columns.description: Link strength radially, average radial FoF link relative to the separation allowed by the FoF algorithm (0<=LinkStrenZ<=1)
columns.name: LinkStrenRad

columns.description: Link strength combined, average of LinkStrenProj*LinkStrenZ for all the links in the group (0<=LinkStrenComb<=1)
columns.name: LinkStrenComb

columns.description: Mass proxy times the global A factor required to get a median unbaised halo mass estimate (A=10.0, see Robotham et al. 2011 section 4.3 for details)
columns.name: MassA

columns.description: Mass proxy times the functional A factor which is a function of Nfof and IterCenZ (see Robotham et al. 2011 section 4.3 for details)
columns.name: MassAfunc

columns.name: RadKurt

columns.name: AxAng

columns.description: Axial ratio of the group using the Carter & Metcalfe (1984) algorithm (requires 3 or more members, so -999 otherwise)
columns.name: AxRat

columns.name: MassAfunc

dmu_description: This DMU provides GALEX NUV and FUV photometry for GAMA DR2 objects.
description:
This catalogue contains the result of a simple nearest neighbour
match between InputCatA and GalexPhot, listing only objects included
in DR2. GAMA DR2 objects without a GALEX nearest neighbour within a
distance of 4 arcsec are considered unmatched and are not included
in this catalogue.
name: GalexSimpleMatch

columns.description: Global Object ID of nearest neighbour GALEX object
columns.name: GGOID

columns.description: Flag indicating whether matched GALEX source has FUV flux with S/N >=2.5 (-1=no FUV data)
columns.name: FUVMATCH

columns.description: Distance between GAMA object and nearest neighbour GALEX object
columns.name: NN_DIST

columns.description: Number of GALEX objects found within 4 arcsec of GAMA object
columns.name: NMATCH4

columns.description: Number of GAMA objects the GALEX object is matched to
columns.name: MANY2ONE

columns.description: String list of distances to all GALEX sources within 20 arcsec
columns.name: GNEIGHBOR_DIST

columns.description: String list of names of all GALEX sources within 20 arcsec
columns.name: GNEIGHBOR_NAME

dmu_description: This DMU provides GALEX NUV and FUV photometry for GAMA DR2 objects.
description:
This catalogue contains the result of an advanced match between
InputCatA and GalexPhot, listing only objects included in DR2. The
matching procedure takes into account the possibility of multiple
matches between GALEX and GAMA objects and seeks to reconstruct the
original UV flux of a given GAMA object. GAMA DR2 objects without a
GALEX match are not included in this catalogue.
name: GalexAdvancedMatch

columns.description: Number of GALEX objects involved in the matching
columns.name: NMATCHUV

columns.description: Number of GAMA objects involved in the matching
columns.name: NMATCHOPT

columns.description: ID list of GALEX object used in the flux redistribution calculation using NAME from GalexPhot; string always ends with a comma
columns.name: UVIDXLIST

columns.description: ID list of GAMA objects used in the flux redistribution calculation using SDSS OBJID; string always ends with a comma
columns.name: OPTIDXLIST

columns.description: Combination of the NUV artifact flags of all GALEX objects involved in the matching
columns.name: NUVFLAG

columns.description: Combination of the FUV artifact flags of all GALEX objects involved in the matching
columns.name: FUVFLAG

columns.description: Total NUV flux of all GALEX objects associated with GAMA object (unweighted sum of the flux)
columns.name: FLUXTOT_NUV

columns.description: Total NUV AB magnitude of all GALEX objects associated with GAMA object (unweighted sum of the flux)
columns.name: MAGTOT_NUV

columns.description: Redistributed NUV flux of all GALEX objects associated with GAMA object
columns.name: FLUXSPLIT_NUV

columns.description: Redistributed NUV AB magnitude of all GALEX objects associated with GAMA object
columns.name: MAGSPLIT_NUV

columns.description: Total FUV flux of all GALEX objects associated with GAMA object (unweighted sum of the flux)
columns.name: FLUXTOT_FUV

columns.description: Total FUV AB magnitude of all GALEX objects associated with GAMA object (unweighted sum of the flux)
columns.name: MAGTOT_FUV

columns.description: Redistributed FUV flux of all GALEX objects associated with GAMA object
columns.name: FLUXSPLIT_FUV

columns.description: Redistributed FUV AB magnitude of all GALEX objects associated with GAMA object
columns.name: MAGSPLIT_FUV

dmu_description: This DMU provides GALEX NUV and FUV photometry for GAMA DR2 objects.

This catalogue provides GALEX NUV and FUV curve-of-growth photometry
for all GAMA DR2 objects.

dmu_description: This DMU provides emission and absorption line measurements for all GAMA DR2 AAT spectra, as well as derived physical properties, including the star-formation rate, for all GAMA DR2 spectra and for all SDSS spectra of GAMA DR2 objects.
description:
This is the main table of the SpecLineSFR DMU. It provides Balmer
decrements, Halpha luminosities, Halpha derived star-formation rates
and emission line classifications for all GAMA DR2 objects with 
z > -0.01 (where available).
name: EmLinesPhys

columns.description: Unique ID of the spectrum that provides the best redshift for this object (IS_BEST spectrum)
columns.name: SPECID_BEST

columns.description: Survey the IS_BEST spectrum originated from
columns.name: SURVEY_BEST

columns.description: Heliocentric redshift of the IS_BEST spectrum
columns.name: Z_HELIO_BEST

columns.description: Flow corrected redshift calculated from Z_HELIO_BEST using Tonry et al. model
columns.name: Z_TONRY

columns.description: SDSS r band Petrosian magnitude (not corrected for Galactic extinction)
columns.name: PETROMAG_R

columns.description: Galactic extinction in SDSS r band
columns.name: A_R

columns.description: Distance modulus for 737 cosmology calculated from Z_TONRY
columns.name: DM_70_30_70

columns.description: SDSS r band absolute magnitude: PETROMAG_R - DM_70_30_70 - A_R - K_R; AB magnitude
columns.name: AB_R

columns.description: Unique ID of spectrum on which line measurements were performed (measurement spectrum)
columns.name: SPECID

columns.description: Survey the measurement spectrum originated from
columns.name: SURVEY

columns.description: Heliocentric redshift of the measurement spectrum
columns.name: Z_HELIO

columns.description: Halpha or Hbeta affected by data reduction issues?
columns.name: WARNING_FLAG

columns.description: Is the Balmer decrement measured or estimated?
columns.name: BALMERDEC_FLAG

columns.description: Halpha luminosity corrected for stellar absorption and fibre aperture effects
columns.name: L_APCOR

columns.description: Halpha luminosity corrected for stellar absorption, fibre aperture effects and dust obscuration
columns.name: L_APOBSCOR

columns.description: Halpha derived star formation rate assuming a Salpeter IMF
columns.name: SFR

columns.description: AGN classification based on Kewley et al. (2001)
columns.name: EMLINE_CLASS

description:
This table provides Balmer decrements, Halpha luminosities, Halpha
derived star-formation rates and emission line classifications for
all SDSS spectra of GAMA DR2 objects with any measured Halpha
emission and z > 0.001. The values in this table were derived from
the MPA/JHU SDSS line measurements database.
